His inner palace had an incalculable number of women.
They were promiscuous, had fights, and wouldn't repent.
After they had a fight, he left the palace.
He then left the palace.
He looked for her and didn't know where she was going.
He was so sad and unhappy that he couldn't understand himself.
At the time, there was an immortal.
He possessed the five supernormal powers.
His spiritual legs flew, and his might and spirit were limitless.
He was called 'Blissful.'
He was flying through the air.
Suddenly, he came down.

source_sentence: 何為說愛欲之難離欲之德。
translation: "Why do you explain the difficulty of craving and the virtue of freedom from desire?
He renounces the world and becomes a practitioner.
He cultivates the four pure practices.
After he reaches the end of his life.
He'll be born in a brahma heaven.'
The Buddha told the monks.
"At the time, this was the king of the world's traces.
This monk is the king.
Whoever is an immortal without pleasure?
Then this is me (from the Naraiṣṭasūtra).

source_sentence: 旃陀羅七子為王逼殺失命十
translation: The seven sons of Candra were forced to kill the king and lost their lives.
In the past, seven sons were born into the Candradhvaja family.
The sixth brother attained the path of stream-winner.
The younger was therefore placed in the category of worldlings.

source_sentence: 母人旃陀利得阿那含道。
translation: The mother, Candradhari, attained the path of non-returner.
All seven brothers received the five precepts.
It was the constant rule in that country.
Candradhvaja committed murder.
The men and women of that country.
They commit murder, theft, sexual misconduct, and other grave offenses.
They were all killed by Candradhvaja.
The king then summoned his eldest son and told him.
"There's a man who deserves to die.
Do something to kill him!
He paid homage to him and said.
"I especially want you to be generous and forgiving.
'I've received the five precepts.
I guard myself with caution.
An ant doesn't dare to kill its child.
I can't do wrong.
I'd rather kill myself than violate the precepts.
They wouldn't dare to violate the precepts.
The king then became furious.
He ordered the city to kill him.
He then told the king.
"The body is the king's people.
'My mind is my sustenance.'
If you want to kill them, then you can kill them.
He couldn't allow them to look up and obey.
The king then ordered him to behead them.
Next, he summoned his brothers.
All six of them said.
"They've received the precepts and dare not commit murder.
The king became angry and raged.
He killed them all.
Next, he summoned the younger disciples.
He summoned his younger brother, mother and son, to come together.
When the king saw his mother coming, he became even angrier.
He killed his six sons.
His mother didn't send him away.
Now, she summons the younger one.
Why did you come?
Mother said.
'Please listen to my humble words so I can explain the principle.'
Those six sons before him.
They had all attained the stream entry path.

source_sentence: 正使大王取彼六人碎身如塵者。
translation: Just now, the king will take those six people and crush their bodies like dust.
Never would evil have arisen like a hair on his head.
Now, this little person...
He's in a worldling's world.
Although he cultivates goodness in his body, he hasn't yet received the teaching of the path.
He hasn't yet attained the way.
Therefore, he's mindful of his son.
Since he hasn't yet attained the path.
He might lose his mind.
He's afraid of the king's teaching and order.
He'll cherish his own body and life.
He breaks the precepts and commits murder.
Their bodies are destroyed, and their lives end.
They'll be sent to the Taishan hell.
He took pity on his son.
That's why they sent him here.
The king then asked his mother.
"Did the six sons who died before him.
"Have they all attained the path of stream entry?
He answered.
"They all attained it.
The king then asked his mother.
"What path did she attain in her lifetime?
She replied.
"She has attained the path of non-returner.
When the king heard this, he threw himself to the ground.
He threw himself to the ground.
He said, "I blame myself for my faults.
'I created the root of sin.
I created the intention to kill six streams of streams of saints.

source_sentence: 身意煩惱坐不安席即自嚴辦香油蘇薪。
translation: With his body and mind troubled, he sat down uneasily and then decorated himself with scented oil and firewood.
He took the six dead bodies and gave them a donation.
He then raised six stamps to kill them as offerings.
He repented three times a day.
He wished to extinguish his sins.
Gradually, it wanes.
He then gave out his wealth and goods.
He gives it to his elderly mother.
On the day of the fast, he repeatedly confessed his sins.
He repeatedly repented.
He hoped to attain paucity of sins.

source_sentence: 免於地獄(出慈仁不殺經)。
translation: He'll be spared hell (from the Sutra of Merciful Kindness and Non-Killings).
